intro: Lepianthes peltata, commonly known as the broadleaf pellitory, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive, palmately arranged structure, often with a waxy coating. It produces small, white to greenish flowers in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Lepianthes peltata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
